Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup or little master cup with top of stem; interior: tondo border: alternating black and added red tongues with four bands at inner side; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of upper left side of winged female, standing frontal with head to left (neck, long hair tied back, short sleeved garment with added white, strap across left shoulder and red and white on wing remaining); exterior black.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix ‘b’ was added to distinguish this sherd from another sherd with the same registration number (now designated G 137.23a).
An example of the winged females of difficult identity in such tondi.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0407) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
